message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about telescopes and their purpose. A telescope is used to observe distant objects and is particularly useful for observing astral bodies such as stars, planets, and galaxies. Option (A) is incorrect because mountains can be observed with the naked eye or binoculars. Option (B) and (C) are also incorrect because telescopes are not necessary for observing oceans or clouds.

Mountains, oceans, and clouds can be observed without a telescope, so options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect.

Option (A) is incorrect because telescopes are not usually used for observing mountains, which can be seen with the naked eye. Option (B) is incorrect because telescopes are not used for observing oceans, which are on Earth. Option (C) is incorrect because telescopes are not used for observing clouds, which are also on Earth.
